item.title: Daring Fireball: Resigned
item.description: "Jobs’s greatest creation isn’t any Apple product. It is Apple itself." @gruber thanks for putting it in words. http://t.co/7nnPIFk
item.content:encoded: "Jobs’s greatest creation isn’t any Apple product. It is Apple itself." @gruber thanks for putting it in words. http://t.co/7nnPIFk Reading around the web an hour ago, looking for confirmation of the then-minutes-old news that Steve Jobs had resigned as CEO, I repeatedly encountered and bridled each time at use of the adjective “shocking” to describe the announcement. But my initial resentment was unwarranted. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: daringfireball.net

item.content:encoded: Steve Jobs: The End Of An Era http://t.co/9OYXsi4 by @johnbiggs Biggs is the editor of TechCrunch Gadgets. Biggs has written for the New York Times, InSync, USA Weekend, Popular Mechanics, Popular Science, Money and a number of other outlets on technology and wristwatches. He is the former editor-in-chief of Gizmodo.com and lives in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn. You can Tweet him here and G+ him here. → Learn Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Big Government? Obama Has 273,000 Fewer Federal Employees Than Reagan http://t.co/OVCogAV via @politicususa #p2 #P2b #topprog #obama #dem Federal employment data reveals that Republicans not Democrats increase the size of government. Under President Obama the US has 273,000 fewer federal employees that it did under Ronald Reagan. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Jux Reinvents The Blog as a Full-Screen Experience
item.description: Jux Reinvents The Blog as a Full-Screen Experience http://t.co/24XW7F9
item.content:encoded: Jux Reinvents The Blog as a Full-Screen Experience http://t.co/24XW7F9 Today, a NYC-based startup called Jux has launched a personal publishing platform that kicks a field goal right over the heads of Tumblr and the post-blogging crowd. It's a big, beautiful, dynamic tool full of splashy images and sharp Web fonts. It offers six kinds of basic posts: BlockQuote, Article, Photo, Video, SlideShow, and CountDown. You start from there and build huge, full-screen posts that suck the viewer in. It's like a blog that can crank out whole About.me or Flavors.me pages for every post. You have to see it to get how powerful it is. Power, of course, is... Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: Apple - Press Info - Letter from Steve Jobs
item.description: Read Steve Jobs' resignation letter to #Apple: http://t.co/tRi9Cks
item.content:encoded: Read Steve Jobs' resignation letter to #Apple: http://t.co/tRi9Cks I have always said if there ever came a day when I could no longer meet my duties and expectations as Apple’s CEO, I would be the first to let you know. Unfortunately, that day has come. Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Steve Jobs resigns as Apple CEO, remains on board of directors, recommends Tim Cook as his successor: http://t.co/ONodTH4 Apples ailing chief executive Steve Jobs is officially stepping down from the helm of the company, an historic shift that hands the reins to chief operating officer Tim Cook. item.title: Apple - Press Info - Steve Jobs Resigns as CEO of Apple
item.description: Its not on http://t.co/N2UTyke, but here's the release from the horses mouth: http://t.co/dZgs3CM
item.content:encoded: Its not on http://t.co/N2UTyke, but here's the release from the horses mouth: http://t.co/dZgs3CM CUPERTINO, California—August 24, 2011—Apple’s Board of Directors today announced that Steve Jobs has resigned as Chief Executive Officer, and the Board has named Tim Cook, previously Apple’s Chief Operating Officer, as the company’s new CEO. Jobs has been elected Chairman of the Board and Cook will join the Board, effective immediately. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: apple.com

item.content:encoded: Here it is: Slate Lays Off Jack Shafer, Several Others | Adweek http://t.co/6Emphh1 Slate, the online news magazine owned by the Washington Post Company, has laid off a number of employees, including editor-at-large Jack Shafer, Adweek has learned.  “We have made some editorial changes, including a small reduction in our full time staff and our contractors,” editor David Plotz confirmed. item.content:encoded: Jobs resigns as Apple CEO, to stay as chairman: Steve Jobs has resigned as CEO of Apple, but will stay on as cha... http://t.co/98x34dy [Updated at 6:57 p.m. ET] Apple CEO Steve Jobs has resigned and will be replaced by former Chief Operating Officer Tim Cook, the company said late Wednesday. item.title: Breaking: Steve Jobs resigns. Tim Cook new Apple CEO — Tech News and Analysis
item.description: Breaking: Letter from Steve Jobs who just resigned as CEO of Apple. Wants to be chairman. http://t.co/JhiVqZa
item.content:encoded: Breaking: Letter from Steve Jobs who just resigned as CEO of Apple. Wants to be chairman. http://t.co/JhiVqZa Steve Jobs, a remarkable man and a maverick CEO today resigned from the top job at Apple, making way for Tim Cook, currently company's COO. Jobs wants to be the chairman of the company as he battles with his illness. It's an end of an era. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gigaom.com
